newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Rubber maker K&P seen in HK$55 mln IPO - sources.
newsitem.headline: Rubber maker K&P seen in HK$55 mln IPO - sources.

text.p: Conductive silicone rubber maker K&P International Holdings Ltd is expected to issue 55 million new shares at HK$1.00 each, and one warrant is expected to be attached for every five shares, market sources said on Monday.
The issue price represents a prospective fully diluted price to earnings multiple of 6.7 times, with prospective earnings per share for the year ending December 31 of HK$0.149, they said.
The company is expected to have a market capitalisation of HK$220 million following listing, sources said.
Flotation of the shares is expected to run from December 12-17, with dealing expected to begin on January 2, they said. Lippo Securities is expected to be the sponsor of the issue.
The core business of K&P is the manufacture of conductive silicone rubber keypads, alarm clocks, electronic calculators and other plastic products, sources said.
Proceeds are expected to be used to build a new factory in the Chinese city of Shenzhen to complement existing production facilities in Guanlan and Zhongshan, and to buy machinery, sources said.
K&P posted a profit of about HK$23 million for the year ended December 31, 1995, up from HK$20 million in 1994 and HK$10 million in 1993.
The company forecast a profit of not less than HK$32 million for this year, sources said.
